oai_dc:dc.dc:title: STUDY OF Y AND LU IRON GARNETS USING BETHE-PEIERLS-WEISS METHOD
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: GOVEAS, N
MUKHOPADHYAY, G
MUKHOPADHYAY, P
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: molecular field
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We study here the magnetic properties of Y- and Lu- Iron Garnets using the Bethe-Peierls-Weiss method modified to suit complex systems like these Garnets. We consider these Garnets as described by Heisenberg Hamiltonian with two sublattices (a,d) and determine the exchange interaction parameters J(ad), J(aa) and J(dd) by matching the exerimental susceptibility curves. We find J(aa) and J(dd) to be much smaller than those determined by Neel theory, and consistent with those obtained by the study of spin wave spectra; the spin wave dispersion relation constant obtained using these parameters gives good agreement with the experimental values.
